original_data.question: A gunshot victim is brought to the Emergency Department and appears to be in shock. You note a penetrating wound at the level of L3. Assuming the bullet remained at this level, which vascular structure might have been injured?

model_response:
The inferior vena cava is located in the retroperitoneal space, lying on the right side of the abdominal cavity. It is the most likely large vascular structure to be injured at the level of L3. The internal iliac vein lies within the pelvis, and the renal artery and portal vein are located in the retroperitoneal space superior to the inferior vena cava.

###Answer: OPTION A IS CORRECT.</s><s>

question_entities.definition: Disruption of structural continuity of the body as a result of the discharge of firearms.
Hospital department responsible for the administration and provision of immediate medical or surgical care to the emergency patient.
A pathological condition manifested by failure to perfuse or oxygenate vital organs.
bodily injury caused by physical means, with disruption of the normal continuity of structures.
A position on a scale measuring intensity, quality, or amount.
A position on a scale measuring intensity, quality, or amount.
Any of the tubular vessels conveying the blood (arteries, arterioles, capillaries, venules, and veins).
